channel.title: Australian Internet
channel.description:
this is a QQ thread about how much i'd move to america just for their internetz.
I pay 70$ (65$ USD) a month to get a 1.5mbit connection (max 160kbs down) 12GB shared download/upload bandwidth limit. If i go over that limit i get slowed to 64k speeds.
This is shit, complete shit because i hear that in america u can get like 20mbit connection with unlimited downloads etc for like 40$?
This stops me from making a huge movie/games collection, rly rly sucks. a friend i got in america, i was gonna send him like 2 boxes of 50dvds blank dvds to load up with warez and send back, in the end that cost the same amount of money as me sending him 100$ and him ordering me a 640gig HDD off newegg to fill up with torrented games n movies.
So like (talking to you other australians that is) r u pissed off with our shit internetz? stops me havin a home cinema of like every movie possible.

item.title: Australian Internet
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“alpha_omega, post:9, topic:223460”]I’d have to say Australia’s internet performance to the cost price is very poor. My plan is BigPond ADSL Liberty* (12GB) 1500/256 $69.95 monthly. Although, I wouldn’t mind breaking into a Telstra Exchange to get my hands onto a DSLAM. Hello speed!

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DSLAM[/quote]

You misunderstand what a DSLAM is, by the way.

You are using one, right now.

Read full topic

item.title: Australian Internet
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:27, topic:223460”]Dear everyone,

Please stop using the term bandwidth incorrectly.

Sincerely,
Mopman[/quote]
A more constructive “quote and fix” type of post would be a little helpful instead of addressing everyone on something someone else did.

Sincerely,
Kane.

Read full topic

item.title: Australian Internet
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

Holy shit, you guys pay a lot for little.

I pay $30 a month CAD for

# Up to 5 Mbps download speed # Up to 512 Kbps upload speed # 60 GB/month data transfer # 10 Personal email accounts # 7 No Cost Extras # Up to two IP addresses** # 24/7/365 technical assistance
Never hit anywhere near 5 Mbps.

Read full topic

@Shorty626 wrote:

Lol, I live in Florida. No Bandwidth Limit, 50MBPS DL, 15MBPS UL, $60 a month. And, I have never had a problem with it. No slowness, and it always works (Unless the power goes out). Buy Australian internet sounds like shit.

item.title: Australian Internet
item.dc:creator: @alpha_omega1 alpha_omega
item.description:
@alpha_omega1 wrote:

I’d have to say Australia’s internet performance to the cost price is very poor. My plan is BigPond ADSL Liberty* (12GB) 1500/256 $69.95 monthly. Although, I wouldn’t mind breaking into a Telstra Exchange to get my hands onto a DSLAM. Hello speed!

en.wikipedia.org

Digital subscriber line access multiplexer

A digital subscriber line access multiplexer (DSLAM, often pronounced DEE-slam) is a network device, often located in telephone exchanges, that connects multiple customer digital subscriber line (DSL) interfaces to a high-speed digital communications channel using multiplexing techniques. The DSLAM equipment collects the data from its many modem ports and aggregates their voice and data traffic into one complex composite "signal" via multiplexing. Depending on its device architecture and setu...

Read full topic

item.title: Australian Internet
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:6, topic:223460”][quote author=Kane. link=topic=293513.msg2362133#msg2362133 date=1217676261]
I’m in Australia, and my internet’s not that bad… Although, compared to oversea’s, like you said, i am extremely dissapointed.

We pay $100/month (for phone + internet) for ADSL2+.
Which is 24mb/ps.

And even though we’re only about ~1km away from the host, the most i’ve ever seen our internet download at was 1.2mb/s, and that’s very rare. Depending on the websites server, we average at about 300-700kb/s.

Get better, Australia.
[/quote]
There reason can be bad copper and your are to long away from the host.[/quote]
I know my speed is in relation to the distance between me and the host. Hence me mentioning it.
I stand by my post.

GET BETTER, AUSTRALIA.

Read full topic
